intro: Ribes alpestre var. eglandulosum, commonly known as the glandless gooseberry, is a shrub native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of flowering plants in the family Grossulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its small, glandless leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its berries, though edible, are typically small and tart, often used in local culinary traditions. The species is adapted to harsh mountain environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
